alert.note: Alert for Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 27 at 2:27PM MDT until March 28 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 7 PM MDT TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong west to northwest winds combined with low humidity this afternoon will continue to produce several hours of critical fire weather conditions over northeast and east central New Mexico. Winds will turn strong over the northeast highlands and adjacent northeastern plains on Tuesday afternoon, leading the potential for more marginally critical to critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104) from 1 pm to 7 pm MDT today and a Fire Weather Watch for Tuesday from 1 pm to 7 pm MDT. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts to near 45 or 50 mph today. Winds out of the south on Tuesday at 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from about 9 to 12 percent today and down to 15 to 20 percent on Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
